main event: A couple observed a bright round silvery object moving in a northerly direction in Greenwich, Connecticut.
interesting points: The sighting occurred on September 7, 1962, at approximately 6:15 P.M.,The object was larger than a star and moved at a high speed, much faster than any airplane,The object changed direction slightly, moving in a northeasterly direction,The sky was clear at the time and the object was easily visible against the blue background, The witness is a former Naval officer with experience in aerial phenomena.
sighted object: a bright round silvery object in the sky
witness description: A couple, including a former Naval officer.
